title: Development of a Mathematical Modeling-Based Learning Model for Fostering Values and Attitudes in Islamic Religious Education

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level expertise and extensive practical experience in the field, with comprehension of basic mathematical concepts (set theory, matrices, statistics)
context.additional_context: A competency-enhancement program for pre-service/in-service teachers. Analyzes workplace moral dilemmas through mathematical modeling (decision trees, optimization algorithms) with emphasis on analytical and practical application of Islamic value systems.

learning_goals: Learners will clarify core values presented in Islamic religious education and systematically categorize them using mathematical classification systems and set theory
Learners will implement the values clarification approach (choice-review-action) through matrix analysis and decision tree models to make ethical decisions in real workplace scenarios
Learners will optimize their value application cases using feedback-based improvement algorithms (modify-iterate) and enhance social attitudes by statistically analyzing peer evaluation data
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
